channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sofa abandoned, 17th November
item.description:
Please check and remove. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 181, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Corner of Hartland road and Donaldson Road, 17th November
item.description:
The drain / Gulley has hardened asphalt that has set inside the drain. When the road calming measures were laid some years ago, the hump at the junction of Hartland and Donaldson, the contractors poured asphalt down the gulley. Although the gulley does drain slowly in times of heavy rain the entire road floods. The drain grill needs to be removed and the set asphault / tarmac removed. Kind regards Robert Bourke

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Donaldson Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle on the road - left decaying for the past 9 months, 17th November
item.description:
The vehicle appears to be abandoned. It has been parked outside 10 Camdale Road in the exact same position for around 9 months and has not moved at all. The tyres are flat, the car has visible mould on the bodywork, and it no longer has a valid MOT. The vehicle looks neglected and unused and is causing a nuisance to residents. Please investigate and arrange removal.”
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Camdale Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: King Henry’s Rd near St Mary’s Church, 17th November
item.description:
I’m reporting this again as the most recent report (FixMyStreet ref: 7272153) was closed and marked as fixed, despite the update giving no indication that any work is planned to be carried out. This is a significant road defect that has been left unaddressed for several years, and local residents are becoming increasingly frustrated by the lack of progress. I remain hopeful that Camden will take the necessary steps to repair this entire section of road, but an update with some clear, relevant information would be greatly appreciated. Could you please advise when this area will be levelled and made safe?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, King Henry's Road, Belsize Park, Hampstead, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Insufficient lightning on The Drive, 17th November
item.description:
The street is extremely dark at night, which makes it difficult to see pedestrians, vehicles, and potential hazards. It also increases the feeling of insecurity for residents walking home after dark. This is not related to a single faulty lamp — the entire street is generally under-lit. I would be grateful if the council could review the lighting levels. The brightness under each street lamp is fine, but it’s the fact that the street lights don’t project enough light in the spaces between the street lamps, which makes for extremely dark areas. This has been an on going issue since the installation of LED lights in the street. This issue can increase the chance of car theft and make the road unsafe for people walking down the street late at night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely dark, no visibility, light not working, 17th November
item.description:
Extremely dark, no visibility in rear mirrors of the path or road when reversing onto the road. Especially now that it gets dark early it’s extremely difficult to see and also dangerous for drivers and in generally safety.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Freelands Road, Plaistow, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very long hold time in favour of pedestrians, 17th November
item.description:
When the traffic lights turn red, the TL stays red for 35 seconds. However, frequent observations show that pedestrians clear the crossing in 9-11 seconds. Please shorten the hold time for the pedestrians to 15 seconds. Alternatively, change the roadway light to flashing amber after 15 seconds,. to reduce the congestion to the vehicular traffic if the crossing is clear. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 331, Rochester Way, Well Hall, Eltham, Royal Borough of Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wrong Street Signage, 17th November
item.description:
The signage shows 'No Entry' Except Buses . However this road (straight ahead across the junction) is the access to Kidbrooke Square Estate and vehicles are permitted. Please remove the no entry symbol from the sign.

item.title: Leaves need collecting, 17th November
item.description:

item.title: New post lights wobbling, 17th November
item.description:
Please can the new pathway post lights be installed correctly. A couple of them wobble and they’ve only been in a couple of days. They have wobbled right from installation. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass seed required, 17th November
item.description:
When the workers were putting in a new pathway and lights they dug up the grass that belongs to Bromley Palace Park. They have spread grass seed on their land, but have neglected to spread grass seeds at the side of the path which is in Bromley Palace Park. Please can this be rectified. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet
